author: Staff Reporter
text:
P.V.K. Sitabai recieves an award at International Women’s Day celebrations organised by Women Entrepreneurs (WE) forum in Madurai on Tuesday.— Photo: R. Ashok

Various institutions and organisations across Madurai observed International Women’s Day by organising events not only to honour women but also to focus on issues faced by them.

In the event organised by Samam Kudimakkal Iyakkam, a Madurai-based NGO, a resolution was passed demanding 50 per cent reservation for women in legislature.

The NGO also passed resolutions demanding enactment of a separate law to deal with honour killings, providing enforcement powers to national and State commissions for women and steps to nurture gender equality in all walks of life.

Women Entrepreneurs (WE), women empowerment forum of Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry, organised day-long celebrations with various sessions, including those to create health awareness among women.

Actor Nalini and WE chairperson Rajkumari Jeevagan spoke at the event.

Meme creation

Centre for Women’s Studies of Lady Doak College organised an event in which writer Thamizhachi Thangapandian participated. Following a meme creation event for students, Ms. Thamizhachi moderated a discussion on issues faced by women.

In her speech, she highlighted the crucial role played by memes in today’s social media-dominated world in changing the status quo. Alumnae of the college spoke on gender equality and shared their experience on how the college groomed them in carving out a successful career.

Similar events were organised in The American College and a number of other institutions in the city.
title: International Women’s Day observed across Madurai
